decks.notes: The main focus of this Mardu Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push to clear the way for attacks. Additionally, the inclusion of planeswalkers like Gideon and creatures like Archangel Avacyn provides versatility and protection against removal spells. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

The strength of this deck lies in its aggressive strategy focusing on quickly developing a powerful board presence through efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Veteran Motorist, along with vehicles like Heart of Kiran and Cultivator's Caravan. Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push provide removal options, while Gideon, Ally of Zendikar serves as a versatile threat. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and efficient removal spells, maintaining a proactive game plan throughout the match.

The key concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to maintain a strong board presence by utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures such as Toolcraft Exemplar and Thraben Inspector to quickly establish threats on the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes strong removal spells like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration to eliminate opposing threats. The inclusion of Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn provides additional power and resilience. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and effective removal spells.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to flood the board with low-cost creatures and pump them up with anthem effects like Always Watching and Thalia's Lieutenant. This allows you to quickly overwhelm your opponent with an army of powerful creatures, such as Hanweir Garrison and Glory-Bound Initiate. Declaration in Stone serves as removal, while Expedition Envoy and Town Gossipmonger help you establish early board presence. The goal is to apply constant pressure, utilizing efficient creatures and combat tricks to win the game before your opponent can stabilize.

The main goal of this deck is to slow down and control the opponent's board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness while also building card advantage with cards like Grim Flayer and Vessel of Nascency. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope and Ob Nixilis Reignited to further control the game. Additionally, cards like Walking Ballista and Noxious Gearhulk provide removal and board presence. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and out value them in the late game with cards like Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Gonti, Lord of Luxury.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent through aggressive creature plays and efficient removal spells. By utilizing powerful creatures like Heart of Kiran, Toolcraft Exemplar, and Scrapheap Scrounger alongside removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the defensive while maintaining a steady flow of threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Gideon of the Trials adds additional versatility and resilience to the aggressive game plan, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize and turn the tide in their favor.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, using strong creatures and removal spells to pressure the opponent. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Scrapheap Scrounger, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional threats and can create an army of tokens. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent and seize control of the game early on.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Night Market Lookout, Glint-Sleeve Siphoner, and Dread Wanderer to apply pressure on the opponent. Removal spells such as Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness help clear the way for attacks, while cards like Collective Brutality provide versatile options for disruption. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalker Liliana, the Last Hope to generate card advantage and control the board. With a mix of efficient creatures and removal, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters and powerful aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents. By playing efficient creatures like Winding Constrictor and Longtusk Cub, while also removing threats with cards like Grasp of Darkness and Fatal Push, this deck aims to maintain board control and pressure opponents early on. The synergy between cards like Rishkar, Peema Renegade and Walking Ballista allows for explosive plays and potential to quickly finish off opponents. With a strong curve and a mix of removal and threats, this deck aims to be a fast and resilient aggro deck.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. It includes a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness, along with powerful creatures like Lord of the Accursed and Plague Belcher to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Liliana, the Last Hope and Dark Salvation provide additional utility and creature removal. The deck also includes synergistic zombies like Cryptbreaker and Diregraf Colossus to maintain board presence and apply pressure. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Thermo-Alchemist and Stormchaser Mage, along with burn spells like Shock and Incendiary Flow, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Fevered Visions provide additional sources of damage and card advantage. The deck also includes some card draw and discard effects to maintain momentum and dig for key cards. Ultimately, the goal is to apply continuous pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It includes cards like Negate, Disallow, and Essence Scatter for disruption, along with Glimmer of Genius and Pull from Tomorrow for card advantage. The deck also features removal options like Cast Out and Harnessed Lightning, making it difficult for opponents to establish a strong board presence. Finishers like Torrential Gearhulk provide additional value and help close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the control elements while also enabling consistent spell casting.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Scrapheap Scrounger, backed up by efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration. It aims to apply pressure early and often, utilizing vehicles like Heart of Kiran to punch through opposing defenses. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nahiri, the Harbinger provide additional threats and card advantage. Overall, the deck is designed to maintain a fast-paced tempo and overwhelm opponents with a combination of creatures, removal, and powerful planeswalker abilities.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly by playing aggressive creatures and using powerful removal spells. By utilizing cards like Scrapheap Scrounger, Toolcraft Exemplar, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, the deck can apply early pressure and control the board. Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push provide efficient removal options, while Heart of Kiran can quickly become a threatening flyer. With a mix of creatures, removal, and planeswalkers, this deck looks to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of the deck is to efficiently ramp up energy using cards like Attune with Aether and Aether Hub in order to activate Aetherworks Marvel and cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also utilizes cards like Rogue Refiner and Glimmer of Genius to generate card advantage and control the board with removal spells like Magma Spray and Kozilek's Return. Additionally, cards like Dynavolt Tower provide additional energy generation and synergy with spells, creating a powerful combo-focused strategy.

The deck focuses on generating energy with cards like Servant of the Conduit and Aether Hub to fuel the ability of Aetherworks Marvel to cheat Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger onto the battlefield. Whirler Virtuoso and Rogue Refiner provide additional energy and card draw to keep the combo going. Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Nissa, Steward of Elements provide extra utility and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board early on with removal spells like Harnessed Lightning and then win the game by casting powerful threats like Ulamog.
